For a basic appreciation of brewing from a more molecular perspective than I have offered in this book, Brewing
by my friend and colleague Emeritus Professor Michael Lewis, together with Tom Young, is the start-off point. A more detailed account is given in C

container-title: In terms of quality measurements, it would be strange of me not to recommend another of my own offerings, Standards of Brewing: A Practical Approach to Consistency and Excellence
title: For those in search of much more detail on barley, the volume of choice should be Barley: Chemistry and Technology
Hops
Yeast is covered extensively by two of my longest and dearest pals in the industry, Chris Boulton and David Quain, Brewing Yeast and Fermentation
while two more friends, Denise Baxter and Paul Hughes, address the beer itself in Beer: Quality, Safety and Nutritional Aspects

note: remains possibly the most instructive historical treatise on brewing.
